entry.title: Equal Columns With Flexbox: It’s More Complicated Than You Might Think
entry.summary: As awesome as flexbox is, what it’s doing under the hood is actually a little strange because, by default, it is doing two things at once. It first looks at the content size which is what we would get if by declaring width: max-content on an element. But on top of that, flex-shrink is also doing some work allowing the items to be smaller, but only if needed. Let’s break those two down and see how they work together. The post Equal Columns With Flexbox: It’s More Complicated Than You Might Think appeared first on CSS-Tricks. You can support CSS-Tricks by being an MVP Supporter.

entry.title: How We Improved Our Core Web Vitals (Case Study)
entry.summary: Google’s “Page Experience Update” will start rolling out in June. At first, sites that meet Core Web Vitals thresholds will have a minor ranking advantage in mobile search for all browsers. Search is important to any business, and this is the story of how Beau Hartshorne and his team at Instant Domain Search improved their Core Web Vitals scores.
